data.title: Our Team - MYOB's #1 Partner
data.meta_description: Get to know the team behind Kilimanajro Consulting. We are the MYOB's number one partner for implementing MYOB Acumatica and MYOB Exo.
data.text:
What I do at Kilimanjaro

My primary role is to guide the tribe up the mountain. This means maintaining a level of awareness of what‚Äôs happening over the horizon, and nurturing my tribe to respond quickly to those opportunities or threats. I provide leadership and motivation, and try to encourage my tribe to live within our Golden Rules. Formally, I am responsible for the selection and appointment of our leadership. I assist my team leaders to develop policies, objectives and indicators. I monitor the progress and performance of our tribal team leaders. I like to maintain relationships with our key clients and allies. Statutory compliance and financial performance are important to me. The most important task is understanding every member of the tribe, and helping them to achieve personal excellence.

What I bring to the Tribe

I have more than 30 years‚Äô experience as an entrepreneur, management consultant, senior executive, director and agribusiness professional. My diverse background, combined with strong analytical and facilitation skills, has given me a deep insight into businesses across most industry sectors and in various stages of development. My background explains the Kilimanjaro name and is central to our commitment to working with clients as a ‚Äúfarmers not hunters‚Äù ‚Äìwilling to invest for the long-term and keen to nurture lasting and trusted relationships. I like to think I have some wisdom, but not in the sense of being a ‚Äúwise old man‚Äù. I also bring youth and humour.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I manage the local operation as the proxy of CEO Ronnie Baskind. This involves general management, all local HR matters, revenue & sustainability, facilities and logistics. I am driven to lead good people to achieve great things.

‚ÄúWith inspired people, customers will consistently get great service‚Äù.

What I bring to the tribe

I was the previous owner of Bizpro NZ Ltd, GlobalBizpro Ltd (sold to Enprise 2015) and have 25 years in software sales and consulting. With extensive experience in selling and implementing software solutions for business generally, my key passion lies within Manufacturing and Retail (POS Systems).

Outside of work, I enjoy playing the guitar, refereeing touch rugby, running, mountain biking and caravanning as well as being a try-hard comedian.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My primary role is to keep the tribe moving. Whether this is the logistics of how we continue to move (through the methodology) or the day to day running we keep moving. It is important that our tribe is the leader in our field, moving faster than all others. Together with this, we continually improve efficiencies and up skilling of our tribe members which in turn benefits our clients. I ensure that all tribe members follow our Golden Rules and reinforce the importance of these on a daily basis. I love to work with every member of the tribe and enjoy watching them grow. I strongly believe that our people are our greatest asset.

What I bring to the Tribe

My formal qualifications are in Engineering where I majored in software engineering. Applying the principles in engineering to software solutions is very near to my heart and something I believe in. This can be seen through our structured methodology that has evolved with us over all these years. It can also be seen in the internal systems we have in place such as our own Wiki and structured way of organising and presenting information. I feel there is always a solution and an answer to every question and working these through with my team is what I bring to the tribe most. There is no better feeling than solving what seems to be an impossible question for a client working with a team.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My role within Kilimanjaro is constantly evolving and I love the way it keeps me on my toes. Having studied teaching and business management at UTS, learning was and will always be my primary focus. Whether it be designing and delivering custom training for highly configured sites or ensuring a UAT program is adequately catering to the needs of an organisation, my aim is to ensure that the technology we deliver is understood by the client. We have some of the smartest technical minds in the business but unless our clients can use and understand this technology, their efforts will be wasted. I am also directly involved as an implementer on a number of projects and as a result, have developed a deep respect for our methodology.

What I bring to the tribe

I have worked with a wide variety of industries in developing national training programs, as well as delivering coaching and change management programs in top tier consulting firms during my three years in the UK. This has given me strong project management and communication skills as well as a unique insight into the people who work in our client organisations. I am particularly focused on individual and client needs and always look for the Win-Win solution. Wherever possible this is achieved through the use of coaching techniques so that everyone feels ownership of the final solution. 1 + 1 definitely equals 3.

What I do for Kilimanjaro

I‚Äôm involved in formulating strategy around the support process and helping our teams to implement that strategy. I‚Äôm also responsible for communicating our strategic vision and aligning our processes to that vision. A key focus is #ClientFirst and my job is to role model client-centric behaviours and reinforce those behaviours in others. I still spend a large part of my day working directly with customers in a consulting capacity. I also pick up the odd support call along the way!

What I bring to the team

I‚Äôve worked for about 20 years in the finance + IT space, including 15 years with Enprise. Prior to that, I worked as a Tax Accountant for EY London (great fun!) and Deloitte‚Äôs. I hold a degree in Human Resource Management and a Diploma in Management Systems. It‚Äôs only taken me 30 years to start putting some of that study into practice!

I‚Äôm an avid rugby fan and played rugby up until I was about 45. I use the term ‚Äúplayed‚Äù loosely. I‚Äôm blessed to be married to my wife Dallas, who is as passionate about cooking good food as I am about eating it. We travelled to Europe when we were younger before returning to New Zealand to start a family. Our idea of a perfect holiday now is camping with friends at one of Northlands amazing beaches.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My role within Kilimanjaro, in addition to being a member of the management team, is to work closely with business leaders and help them on their journey of assessing ERP Solutions within the MYOB platform, with the ultimate goal to improve efficiency in their organisations.

By utilising my experience with ERP products, Kilimanjaro‚Äôs methodologies and industry knowledge, I am able to help minimise risk for potential clients throughout their journey ‚Äúone step at a time‚Äù.

What I bring to the Tribe

I have had a long association (over 17 years) with ERP solutions. First implementing end end-to-end business solutions across a wide range of industries and then focusing on business process improvement in businesses through better utilisation of their ERP and incorporating ‚Äúbest of breed‚Äù connected services. I bring not only a deep technical product knowledge but experience in analysing business needs and helping potential clients with their decisions to move onto the MYOB platform and letting Kilimanjaro Consulting guide them on this journey.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My primary role within Kilimanjaro is to understand our customer‚Äôs needs. I lead Kilimanjaro‚Äôs Strategic Account Management and Connected Services team as we support our customers and engage with the broader tribe to identify solutions and services that will benefit our customers and help them ‚Äôsharpen the spear‚Äô.

We recognise that technology is one element of transformation, that people and processes need to be aligned, and that culture and change are often the most significant challenges our customers face. MYOB Exo and MYOB Advanced are key technology enablers in our customer‚Äôs journey to optimise operational efficiency, enhance customer value, manage risk and uncover new revenue opportunities.

What I bring to the Tribe

I‚Äôve worn many hats in my career including software development, ERP implementation and IT management responsibilities. This multi-disciplinary perspective helps me understand the business drivers, while also getting both the big picture and the intricate details.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As the finance manager, I prepare the workings and journal entries for the month-end close and month-end reconciliations for Kilimanjaro Consulting. I also organise the payments to our suppliers on a weekly basis, ensuring our finances are up-to-date. Additionally, I am working with the NZ team in transitioning the finance function for ANZ, and oversee the rollout of Expense Manager in NZ.

What I bring to the tribe

Prior to working in Australia, I have over 3 and a half years of experience as a finance manager in a similar-sized company in Ireland. My expertise in reporting comes from my experience in month-end consolidated reporting and leading the company audit each year. When the opportunity comes, I like to travel. When I‚Äôm not travelling, I like to catch up with friends and go to the gym (or at least try to!).

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I am in charge of the Marketing Department, responsible for developing, implementing and executing Kilimanjaro‚Äôs Marketing Plan. In everyday tasks, I promote the business‚Äô vision and mission in line with the Kilimanjaro brand. I manage all Marketing Communication channels making sure our current and potential clients are informed and have easy access to information about Kilimanjaro.

What I bring to the tribe

I always say there is room for improvement, and I bring a drive to make things better. With over 8 years of experience in marketing in the ERP industry, I feel confident with taking Kilimanjaro to the top of the marketing mountain. I admire challenging tasks, working with clients and building outstanding relationships with them. I have completed an Engineering degree in Spatial Development and Infrastructure but decided to change my career pathway into Marketing where I have found my true passion. Following my heart, I have gained my marketing skills during Postgraduate studies in Digital Marketing.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I am an MYOB Exo team leader in New Zealand. My team provides implementation, customisation, and support services to clients across all of New Zealand. With over 100 years of combined ERP software experience, we can offer solutions to even the most complex problems. My team‚Äôs expertise specialises in job costing, manufacturing and supporting POS/Retail customers. I champion a collaborative approach and encourage knowledge-sharing within my team.

What I bring to the Tribe

I have worked with MYOB Exo and in the ERP field for almost 20 years. I pride myself on bridging the gap between financial, operational and technical challenges. I enjoy talking to clients and understanding how their businesses work so that I can assist them.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As Team Leader of support for Kilimanjaro‚Äôs MYOB Advanced clients, it is my role to make the support process as smooth and efficient as possible. I am the first point of contact when clients go live with implementations, to introduce them to the support team and the process on how we will support them. The support team need to be responsive to identify which cases are the most urgent and the priority but also responding to all cases in a timely manner. This allows clients to continue using the product as effectively as possible.

What I bring to the tribe

I have over 20 years of experience supporting clients in financial applications. I bring a fresh analytical mind to every support query to try and solve them as quickly as possible. Often the answer can be right in front of you if you can see with fresh eyes. For example, did you know that Kilimanjaro has the 5 consecutive letters KLMNO within in it, and in the right order?

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My primary role is to assist clients with implementing MYOB Advanced Payroll in their organisations. This includes system design, system build, training and live processing. I also support the client with their day-to-day processing and reporting needs. I also support clients in MYOB Advanced Business with my 5+ years of experience in the product.

My goal is to always strive to create solutions that are beneficial to our clients and aim to make their jobs as easy and smooth as possible.

What I bring to the tribe

I am a qualified Chartered Accountant (CA) and have worked in a corporate CA environment. My passion is certainly working with ERP solutions and thinking outside the box to put a smile on our client‚Äôs faces. Outside of work, I love to spend time with family and friends, do a little baking, watch or movie or two, and venture out into new things.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My role is within the Advanced Team providing implementation services. I help businesses manage and achieve growth by designing and configuring ERP systems that are efficient and intuitive. I work closely with clients to ensure the software meets their needs and that it integrates smoothly with their existing systems and business processes.

What I bring to the tribe

With more than 10 years of experience in implementing ERP in Europe, Asia and Australia, I offer an excellent understanding of business processes across a range of industries that have been gained through ERP consultancy. I am an agile thinker, adaptive to change with an exceptional eye for detail. Previously, I worked as an accountant and I now hold a CPA. With this experience, I consistently deliver in a number of ways including cost reduction strategy and project analysis. My end goal is always a successful delivery of any tasks to the client. I have a passion for lifelong professional and personal development.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

At Kilimanjaro, I design, train and implement MYOB Advanced for clients across Australia. I also work closely with current clients to ensure they are taking advantage of product updates as they become available.

What I bring to the tribe

I have 7+ years‚Äô experience implementing and supporting ERP, through this experience I have had the pleasure of working with clients across many industries in Australia and New Zealand. My IT and Systems Management background gives me a unique perspective on issues that come up in implementations and support. I often use this experience to look at the bigger picture, suggesting solutions that fit within/complement a clients existing technology ecosystem.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As the Team Leader for IT, I am responsible for keeping our networks available, safe, and secure. I also manage and develop the ExoHosted platform so that our clients can use MYOB Exo with cloud-based flexibility. I have a strong focus on innovation and technology that helps me guide both the IT and ExoHosted teams, and our clients, towards success.

What I bring to the Tribe

I have more than 20 years of IT knowledge and experience with innovation. This is across software development, MS Dynamics consulting, project management, systems architecture, and network management. My diverse experiences let me find new ways to bring technology to everyone, empowering and improving the way we interact with IT systems. This was the catalyst for developing the ExoHosted Platform, the only sustainable cloud platform built with MYOB Exo in mind.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I oversee the work of 3 core teams at Kilimanjaro Consulting, including VIS, Software Consulting in NZ, and the Innovate team in Australia. I also undertake client development and customisation work and troubleshoot more complex issues. I focus my work around MYOB Exo, but I undertake some development work in MYOB Advanced where needed. I develop customisations for new and existing clients so that the software meets the business‚Äôs unique requirements.

What I bring to the Tribe

I bring more than 21 years of experience with software and its development. For my entire career, I have been a part of the ERP industry. This has given me the experience to work through any pain points or software issues that clients can throw at me. In my free time, I enjoy all things motor racing, snowboarding, and fishing when the New Zealand weather permits it.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

Training and educating staff is critical for getting the most out of your MYOB product. One of our team‚Äôs strengths is the training available to clients across Australia and New Zealand. Recognising the potential for us to provide training opportunities to users of Exo Business, Exo Employer Services and MYOB Advanced, I have the exciting responsibility of managing all our training courses, investigating new opportunities for training and developing new training courses. I also liaison between clients and our consultants to provide customised training tailored specifically to the client‚Äôs needs and requirements.

What I bring to the Tribe

Prior to joining the Kilimanjaro Tribe, I managed the Partner Education Program for MYOB‚Äôs Enterprise Solution Division, upskilling new Exo Business consultants and developing a certification program for Exo Employer Services. Coming from a consulting background, I understand the principals involved in implementing a new system. As a qualified trainer, I also understand the importance of providing relevant and up-to-date training. With nearly two decades of knowledge on payroll and finance, I can ensure that our team provide the most appropriate training to help clients get the most out of their MYOB Exo and MYOB Advanced systems.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My key responsibilities at Enprise are Account Management, Project Management & Manage the Impress NZ Team. I‚Äôm also involved in Client demonstrations/meetings and help to offer possible solutions to meet the client‚Äôs growing business demands. I‚Äôm also a certified consultant and I do help out with Support & Implementations of Software Solutions as and when required.

I‚Äôm certified in the below products:

MYOB Exo Business

MYOB Exo Employer Services (NZ Payroll)

MYOB Exo Employer Services (AU Payroll)

MYOB Advanced People (NZ Payroll)

MYOB Advanced People (AU Payroll)

What I bring to the tribe

I bring the knowledge, expertise and training skills that I have developed over the years since joining Enprise (now Kilimanjaro) as a Junior Support Consultant back in 2009. I now host over 11 years of experience in the MYOB Exo Space. This journey has given me the opportunity to grow my knowledge of ERP systems and challenge myself with heightened responsibilities. I actually left for a time back in 2013, but soon returned after discovering that the grass was not greener on the other side. We have such a good culture and environment here!

In 2016, I was appointed as Support Team Leader in March 2016, tasked with managing and supporting the team to foster growth in each individual role. I enjoyed this so much as I love helping people sharing the knowledge that I‚Äôve gained over the years. Finally, in August 2020, I was given the responsibility of managing more Senior Consultants, and I believe this to be quite a different challenge of its own! But hey ‚Äì who doesn‚Äôt love a challenge!

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I work in the projects team to assist Kilimanjaro‚Äôs customers with any tricky challenges they may be facing as well as training and project management/implementation.

What I bring to the tribe

I have years of experience in consulting, implementation and support of various ERP systems, specialist application software, database administration, SQL and report writing. I enjoy sharing my knowledge with the tribe and our customers. I have worked all around Australia on both the east and west coast of the United States. With formal qualifications in both IT and Accounting, I like using my analytical and problem-solving skills to help people and businesses to perform better. I am highly motivated by good coffee üôÇ

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I work with clients and other project team members on fully understanding the clients‚Äô business needs and finding and delivering the best value possible, tailored to clients‚Äô business systems, structure and processes.

What I bring to the tribe

I bring a thorough understanding of both business and IT perspectives of a business software project through formal education (Master of Science in Computer Science and Master of Business Administration), professional education (ITIL, Prince2, CBAP) and more than a decade of experience (as a business analyst, solution architect, software architect, project manager, change manager and operations manager). I love delivering cutting edge solutions using the most advanced software in the market for the best providers in the market. I strongly believe that I‚Äôm currently in that best position with MYOB Advanced and Kilimanjaro Consulting.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As part of the Marketing Team, I work to follow and carry out the Marketing Plan. I collaborate with the other teams in the company to write informative and up-to-date content for our website, as well as our customer focussed newsletters. I also execute various campaigns and activities that reach clients and help them make informed decisions about improving their business‚Äô efficiency.

What I bring to the tribe

I have almost 10 years‚Äô experience working in inventory-based companies across sales, marketing, management, and stock control. This has given me a fundamental understanding of our current and potential customers‚Äô needs and the gaps that MYOB‚Äôs Enterprise software can fill. I enjoy solving puzzles and pride myself on being able to solve problems both creatively and analytically. I am also a keen sportsman which has fostered my ability to work as part of a team.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

On an average day as a Support Consultant, I provide client services in the hope of resolving any issues raised by our clients via phone or email correspondence. To do so, I liaise with the MYOB Advanced team, MYOB Support team, as well as the clients themselves. Finally, a major part of my role is the maintenance of records and tickets in our MYOB Advanced CRM and case management system.

What I bring to the tribe

As an accounting graduate from St. Paul College of Manila, I have a wealth of over 18 years of experience in the Accounting, Business Analysis and Support Specialist fields. I have also headed teams consisting of Business Analysts, Software Engineers and Quality Analysts in product development in the past and enjoyed taking on the responsibility of working with incredible people. Outside of work, I love watching action movies, gardening and online shopping!

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As a part of the support team, my role revolves around providing solutions to customers in a wide range of areas relating to Exo Business such as processing enquiries, building and modifying reports, and technical questions. In general, I enjoy transferring my knowledge of MYOB Exo Business to the clients so that they can feel empowered to make the most out of their system while making it work for them.

What I bring to the Tribe

I have had the pleasure of working closely with MYOB Exo since 2008. Therefore, I feel confident to bring my experience in support, implementation, and training to the table. I value client service and satisfaction above all else, believing that it is imperative to cultivate and achieve the highest possible standard.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I‚Äôm part of the highly skilled MYOB Advanced Team as a Senior Consultant specialising in MYOB Advanced Business. I am focused on business success through insightful information in a timely and meaningful way. This is done by entering information into systems in as simple and efficient a workflow as possible.

What I bring to the tribe

I have been working with MYOB Advanced and implementing since 2014 and MYOB Exo since 2005. Over the years, prior to my experience with MYOB, I have worked in Software Development, Sales, and Training Roles.

Finding the difference that makes a difference. I bring over 15 years of experience, problem-solving and persistence to the team. Outside of work I enjoy being out in nature through activities such as mountain biking, trail walking, and paddle boarding.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As a consultant, I work on implementation services for new clients whilst supporting existing clients with MYOB Advanced. I also take every opportunity to assist in any capacity, as I love the challenge of finding better solutions.

What I bring to the tribe

With a background in Finance and Accounting Services, I endeavour to use this experience when managing clients and their expectations. Having worked through a number of projects in improving business processes, I am always keen to improve processes and create solutions that are best suited to the client‚Äôs business. After climbing Mt Kilimanjaro, I understand that scaling mountain tops is always a team journey, which is an embodiment of the Kilimanjaro Consulting values.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My role involves various tasks, upgrading software, customisations, working with developers to implement solutions and installation, building framework screens, EDI integrations, report writing and general support queries. The skills I learnt throughout my time here at Kilimanjaro Consulting have taught me how to problem solve ‚Äî this is what I enjoy most! My goal is to provide fast and effective support and solutions for our customers.

What I bring to the Tribe

My IT journey started as a receptionist in 2002 when Enprise first started out. After six months in that position, I started to get itchy feet and was offered a role in support. With how small the team was back then, I was thrown into the deep end, but I loved it. Solving complex problems, and helping others, as well as the connection you make with your clients, has really made me the consultant I am today at Kilimanjaro Consulting. I‚Äôm an advocate for saving our planet and keeping it green, which lead me to start my own little business Purely Natural NZ selling reusable products and health foods. Keeping fit and healthy is a big part of who I am also, I enjoy getting to the gym or out for a run daily if time is on my side üòä My idea of a great weekend is getting out and about to the beach and in nature with my two beautiful boys Bailey and Jacob. I also enjoy watching live music ‚Äì in summer you might just find me at a gig or two!

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I guide our clients up the technology mountain, implementing MYOB Advanced so that they may improve efficiency. I work with our clients from the initial scope to the system set-up, implementation, and training. My focus is to ensure that clients can always use their software effectively.

What I bring to the Tribe

I have over 25 years of experience as a financial accountant. This has given me an extensive knowledge base from which to guide our clients‚Äô finance teams. I have worked across freight forwarding, courier, magazine publishing, manufacturing, and retail. With such a wide range of industry experience, I can better understand the client‚Äôs perspective and what they need from their system. Outside work, I enjoy photography, particularly nighttime photography of architecture and cityscapes.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My primary focus is ExoHosted and looking after over 800 users and 50+ servers, ensuring users can access the environment and work efficiently every day. Making customers the priority allows me to keep an emphasis on our #ClientFirst strategy.

What I bring to the tribe

With my Diploma in Information Technology and Bachelors in Digital Technology specialising in software engineering and website development, I have over 8 years of experience in the IT field, 6 of which have been at Enprise Solutions. I‚Äôm always self-developing and trying to broaden my knowledge, especially with technology changing so rapidly.

I live in the beautiful Bay of Plenty so try and get to the beach as often as I can. Gamer and movie nut, and recently got into the gym scene and indoor football. Would like to do a LOT more travelling, in NZ and abroad, but have recently bought my first home so have switched my priorities to become an interior designer instead.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My role as a consultant is to provide a wide range of support services to the clients of Kilimanjaro Consulting. Working in the busy Client Services team, I provide support on MYOB Exo Business and its many modules.

Thanks to the advances in technology, support can be provided efficiently via a number options including TeamViewer, remote access direct to servers, 3rd party products, phone, email and more. Most days, all the above options are used with my preference being a combination of TeamViewer and phone support. In addition to the relationship that is built from talking to a client, I feel that it is paramount to understand the exact nature of the issue in order to find the right solution. Therefore, listening to the customer, whilst watching their TeamViewer session, is a great way to gain an understanding of the problem.

What I bring to the Tribe

Prior to Kilimanjaro, I completed a Bachelor of Business degree, majoring in Finance and Accounting. Combining the knowledge from this degree along with the technical skills in Exo, will equip me with the ability to solve clients‚Äô problems and assist them in understanding any financial aspects that can arise as a result of these issues. In addition to my degree, I am completing a Chartered Accountant qualification to increase my existing accounting knowledge and improve upon the quality of service that I can provide to my clients.

Having come from a Hospitality background, I highly value customer service and understand its importance. I believe it is imperative that a high standard is achieved. I am always striving to maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

As a goal-driven person, my aim is to reduce the debt outstanding on our debtor‚Äôs ledger. In my time here, I have already made great progress in reducing the debt. 120+days started at 10% and has now been reduced to a mere 3% of the ledger. I am the type of person who likes everything done yesterday. I can‚Äôt stand procrastination and this is reflected in the time I respond to queries from customers. I firmly believe that Credit Control/AR is a function of customer service. To this end, I believe that providing a fast, efficient response to a customer‚Äôs enquiry contributes to the company goal of being the best at what we do and delivering great customer focussed service.

What I bring to the tribe

I started out in Export Sales and moved into Finance. I was the youngest Credit Manager in the history of the first company I worked at in South Africa. In my last role, I was the Assistant Credit Manager responsible for managing the debtors in three countries, with six staff reporting to me. Being more mature, I relish the chance to let my experience do the talking and I am quite happy to work in the background. I am a total Lego fanatic and enjoy the challenge of obtaining the bricks required to build retired, sometimes very expensive sets. K-C already has a cupcake girl, well I am the cheesecake boy. I love cooking and my cheesecakes are second to none. A walk on the beach on weekends is the perfect time to unwind and just have some together time with my partner. We are taking up cycling as well from September.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

My role within Kilimanjaro is to answer support calls and help clients to my best ability. I also refer clients to the most suitable consultant if need be. I work on a range of different issues that could occur in MYOB Exo Business. I look at clients issues and strive to resolve this for them. My role also involves me working on clarity forms and doing simple coding/investigation work in SQL and reading up on the user guide and internal SharePoint to continue learning about Exo.

What I bring to the tribe

I have a background of admin work at a life insurance company, with additional experience in simple data entry and managing customers accounts. I graduated from the University of Auckland where I majored in Accounting and statistics. In my free time, I like to take my dogs for walks and watch tv shows.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

Being a support consultant lets me wear many hats and work in all areas of the MYOB Exo product. I enjoy writing reports and making changes that will assist our customers to better utilise the data in the system to understand their business. I am technically minded, thus custom changes to the system to automate and provide new functionality are another part of my toolbox. I assist with all issues with a smile, from strange accounting entries to those unexpected speedbumps at year-end.

What I bring to the tribe

My career started in FMCG where I worked in a chocolate factory for 9 years. I moved to another company and assisted with their accounting system implementation. Following this, I took some time to travel South and Central America, which was an amazing and expansive journey, before beginning my experience with MYOB Exo in 2019. Within the MYOB Exo system, I enjoy writing reports and creating customisations. In my spare time, I enjoy learning about nature and ways we can work with nature to restore the soil and revitalise our water. I am constantly on the lookout for new technologies that are sustainable and move us away from our reliance on fossil fuels. My hobbies include photography, gardening and learning new skills.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

Carry out all phases of a system implementation including scoping the customer needs, system configuration, training, data conversion, go-live assistance, and support. I work closely with customers to scope solutions needed for customisations and integrations and work with developers, carrying out testing of these developments. Additionally, I support existing customers with queries on all areas of Exo.

What I bring to the tribe

I have 10 years of experience supporting and implementing MYOB Exo with customers across many different industries in New Zealand and Australia. My previous experience includes implementing and supporting another financial system plus project managing and implementing a front of house system in the hotel industry in NZ, Australia, Canada, and the United States. I have an accounting degree from Waikato University and have held various financial positions at different companies in NZ as well as working in the hotel industry in my younger days in both NZ and England, while on my OE. I have a solid understanding of business processes and practices and my accounting knowledge is key in communications with financial management & analysis of accuracy in financial reporting. My previous and current database work, attention to detail and understanding of business process enables me to bridge the gap between the customer and the technical IT guru when working with system integrations or customisations. Outside of work my hobbies include gardening, bush walks, spoiling 2 gorgeous white and ginger kittens we acquired just after lockdown, attending hot rod events in our 1938 Ford Coupe that my husband and I recently purchased and keeping fit by Rock & Roll dancing as often as possible.

What I do at Kilimanjaro

I am part of the highly skilled MYOB Advanced team as a senior consultant implementing financial and distribution solutions across different industries. My expertise is in assisting businesses map their unique requirements and processes to fully integrate into MYOB Advanced. Providing in-depth training to the super users and ensuring that they become well equipped with the necessary tools to understand the full functionality of the system.

What I bring to the tribe

22 years of experience implementing ERP systems in Africa, the US and Australia. I come from an accounting and auditing background, having spent numerous years in supply chain management and warehousing. My expertise and experience equip me well to assist customers in implementing MYOB Advanced into their business.
